original_title: Sri Lanka to bat first against Netherlands; Madushanka in for Rajitha
original_body_lines: Sri Lanka won the toss and opted to bat first against the Netherlands in their first Super Six match of the ICC Cricket World Cup Qualifier tournament in Bulawayo.
Left-arm fast bowler Dilshan Madushanka has been included into the playing XI, replacing right-arm fast bowler Kasun Rajitha.

Madushanka was not in the initial 15-member contingent for the tournament but was sent to Zimbabwe as a stand by player before being drafted into the squad after Dushmantha Chameera was ruled out of the qualifiers with an injury.

Sri Lanka Playing XI: Pathum Nissanka, Dimuth Karunaratne, Kusal Mendis(w), Sadeera Samarawickrama, Charith Asalanka, Dhananjaya de Silva, Dasun Shanaka(c), Wanindu Hasaranga, Maheesh Theekshana, Lahiru Kumara, Dilshan Madushanka
Netherlands Playing XI: Max O'Dowd, Vikram Singh, Wesley Barresi, Bas de Leede, Teja Nidamanuru, Scott Edwards (c & wk), Saqib Zulfiqar, Logan van Beek, Shariz Ahmad, Ryan Klein, Aryan Dutt
